p: An NSP‐ MP fragment was amplified either from pOM2B, with the primers FJJ2010‐99 and FJJ2010‐100 for NSP or FJJ2010‐101 and FJJ2010‐102 for MP, or from pCB2B, with the primers FJJ2010‐98 and FJJ2010‐100 for NSP and FJJ2010‐101 and FJJ2010‐102 for MP (Figure 3a and Table S2). The IR fragment was amplified from either pOM2B, with the primers FJJ2010‐95, FJJ2010‐97, FJJ2010‐103, and FJJ2010‐104, or from pCB2B, with the primers FJJ2010‐95, FJJ2010‐96, FJJ2010‐103, and FJJ2010‐104 (Figure 3 and Table S2). A recognition site for restriction endonuclease ( SacI, BamHI, EcoRV, HindIII or SalI) was incorporated into the primer as appropriate to facilitate cloning. NSP‐ MP and IR were fused to form an IR‐ NSP‐ MP‐IR fragment. The resultant fragment was digested with SacI and SalI and cloned into pCAMBIA1304 to generate pOM1B or pCB1B.
